\documentclass{article}
\input{paper/preamble.tex}

\begin{document}

\section{Emphasis Hierarchy Demonstration}

This document demonstrates the sophisticated emphasis hierarchy optimized for TeX Gyre Pagella.

\subsection{Level 1: Standard Emphasis}
The \emph{standard emphasis} uses Pagella's true italics with 0.5\% tracking for enhanced readability. 
Notice how \emph{nested \emph{emphasis}} automatically switches to upright small caps for the inner level.
Triple nesting: \emph{outer \emph{middle \emph{inner}}} demonstrates the full progression.

\subsection{Level 2: Strong Emphasis}  
For important terms, use \strongemph{strong emphasis} which renders in small caps with 3\% tracking and a 2\% size boost. 
This is perfect for \strongemph{key terminology}, \strongemph{technical concepts}, and \strongemph{definitions}.

\subsection{Level 3: Critical Emphasis}
When you need to highlight \boolemph{critical concepts}, the bold italic with subtle color provides maximum readability while maintaining sophistication. 
Use this for \boolemph{key findings} and \boolemph{important results}.

\subsection{Level 4: Maximum Emphasis}
Use \maxemph{maximum emphasis} sparingly---it combines bold small caps with color and 4.5\% tracking for ultimate impact.
Reserve this for \maxemph{crucial warnings} or \maxemph{primary conclusions}.

\subsection{Special Emphasis Commands}

\paragraph{Term Introduction}
The \termintro{term introduction} command combines italics with small caps for first occurrences of technical terms.

\paragraph{Small Caps Variants}
\begin{itemize}
\item Regular small caps: \regsc{example text} with 3\% tracking
\item Italic small caps: \itsc{sophisticated variant} with 2\% tracking  
\item Bold small caps: \bsc{strong variant} with weight compensation (96\% scaling)
\item Display small caps: \elegantsc{elegant display} with 8\% tracking
\end{itemize}

\subsection{Weight Relationships}

\paragraph{Regular vs. Bold}
Compare regular text with \textbf{bold text} (100\% weight) and \boolemph{compensated bold italic} (97\% scaling).

\paragraph{Size-Specific Compensation}
\begin{itemize}
\item Body text bold: \bsc{97\% scaling}
\item Display bold: \headsc{95\% scaling} 
\item Small text bold: \inlinebsc{97\% scaling}
\end{itemize}

\subsection{Nested Emphasis Examples}

\begin{enumerate}
\item \emph{First level is italic}
\item \emph{First level with \emph{second level} in small caps}
\item \emph{First with \emph{second and \emph{third level}} in bold small caps}
\item \strongemph{Strong with \emph{nested italic} inside}
\end{enumerate}

\subsection{Best Practices}

\paragraph{Do:}
\begin{itemize}
\item Use \emph{standard emphasis} for most cases
\item Reserve \strongemph{strong emphasis} for key terms
\item Apply \boolemph{critical emphasis} to important findings
\item Save \maxemph{maximum emphasis} for rare, crucial points
\end{itemize}

\paragraph{Don't:}
\begin{itemize}
\item Mix too many emphasis levels in one paragraph
\item Use maximum emphasis more than 1-2 times per document
\item Combine color emphasis with already colored text
\item Nest more than three levels deep
\end{itemize}

\end{document}
